item.title: Giannelli Imbula turns down Porto approach
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to our colleagues at La Provence, Marseille central midfielder Giannelli Imbula has turned down an approach FC Porto. The player apparently felt that a move to Portugal would be a step down and the financials on offer did little to … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to our colleagues at La Provence, Marseille central midfielder Giannelli Imbula has turned down an approach FC Porto.

The player apparently felt that a move to Portugal would be a step down and the financials on offer did little to entice him either.

Inter Milan, AC Milan, Valencia and an unnamed English side are currently battling for the Marseille man.

item.title: Le Havre and RC Lens to escape DNCG sanctions
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to our colleagues at L’Équipe, Ligue 2 outfits RC Lens and Le Havre have escaped without a punishment following their meeting with the French football financial watchdog the DNCG. If either side had been found guilty of financial mismanagement, they … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to our colleagues at L’Équipe, Ligue 2 outfits RC Lens and Le Havre have escaped without a punishment following their meeting with the French football financial watchdog the DNCG.

If either side had been found guilty of financial mismanagement, they could have been relegated to lower divisions of French football.

item.title: Christophe Lollichon on Petr Cech
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: Speaking as a guest on RMC radio show Luis Attaque last night, Chelsea’s goalkeeping coach Christophe Lollichon spoke about Petr Cech’s future and the futures of other goalkeepers in the market: extracts below. On Courtois-Cech: “We couldn’t have two magnificent goalkeepers like Courtois and … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
Speaking as a guest on RMC radio show Luis Attaque last night, Chelsea’s goalkeeping coach Christophe Lollichon spoke about Petr Cech’s future and the futures of other goalkeepers in the market: extracts below.

On Courtois-Cech:

“We couldn’t have two magnificent goalkeepers like Courtois and Cech with us at the club for the several seasons. It could not last. A guy like Petr Cech sitting on the bench, it is not easy. I think that everyone knows the value of Petr Cech as a goalkeeper and I think now after the season just gone people know the value of him as a man. He never said anything despite his situation, he always defended the club.&# 8221;

On Cech’s future:

“I think that Petr at 33 years of age still has at least 3 or 4 excellent seasons in him. Whichever top club, all the clubs in the Champions League, he has the level, the experience to play for any of these clubs. A guy like Petr Cech adds value, whether it is Manchester United, Real Madrid all the clubs. Each time he played this season, he played 15 times, he was absolutely remarkable. His professionalism, he loves football, he’s an enthusiast, he is a perfectionist and the club where he goes will have a great opportunity ahead of them.”

“I know that it is talked about a lot (Cech to PSG), I am far from France but I keep up to date via internet. It is obvious that Petr Cech has added value, not that Sirigu is a poor goalkeeper, but I think that Cech is even better than him. Petr knows Ligue 1 well, the problem is when you come from the English league, with all the pressure that comes with it, the quality, the aggressiveness and the rigour that comes with this league, without criticising the French league, but it is true that the competition in France is a little lighter compared to the English league.”

“I also think that his family is very happy in England. A player is happy when his family is happy. And Petr adds a lot of value to the state of his family. I think he would prefer to stay in England. If there are discussions, I wouldn’t know. I think that his first aim is to stay in England.”

“He wants to be in England more. However at the age of 33, you also have to look at the value of the contracts that are offered. The advantage of a club like Arsenal is that it is a club at a very high level. With a style of play that Petr likes, it is also in London, don’t forget that. And finally it is a club with big ambitions for the forthcoming seasons.”

“Does Tottenham have the same ambitions that a club like Arsenal has? Petr has three main aims. To enjoy himself, to win titles and to beat the all time Premier League clean sheet record, he is three away from that. To win titles, I think Arsenal are better placed than Tottenham. The Champions League, I think it is more Arsenal than Tottenham no?”

On Steve Mandanda:

“It is not easy to leave a club (as a goalkeeper). After that all depends on, the aims that you have and on the league where you want to be. I have always said that the English league is the hardest for goalkeepers, but that doesn’t mean that every goalkeeper in the English league is good. Hugo Lloris has shown that he has the qualities to play in England, even if I think I still have some reservations over his ability to deal with aerial situations. I have heard that Steve wants to come to play in England. There are places that could become available. I don’t know what exactly is going on at Manchester United, but I think they’re drawing closer to Ajax goalkeeper Jasper Cillessen, the Dutchman, but there was also this desire to take Lloris, because he is quite similar to De Gea. I don’t think anything is done, I know Crystal Palace are also looking for a goalkeeper so there are doors that could open for goalkeepers.”

item.title: Dimitri Payet suffers wage drop
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to Le Parisien, Marseille attacking midfielder Dimitri Payet has suffered an automatic wage drop as the club has failed to qualify for the Champions League. Since his arrival at Marseille two years ago, Payet has been earning €350k gross a … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to Le Parisien, Marseille attacking midfielder Dimitri Payet has suffered an automatic wage drop as the club has failed to qualify for the Champions League.

Since his arrival at Marseille t wo years ago, Payet has been earning €350k gross a month, but this has been dropped to €250k gross a month as a result of Marseille’s finish in Ligue 1 for the 2014/15 season.

According to sources close to the club, “Marseille must renegotiate his contract or risk losing him”.

Payet had the following to say to the newspaper on manager Marcelo Bielsa:

“He does not want to let me go. He asks me each game to reflect on myself after each game and make better immediately what went wrong. I have never known that in my career. When we look at the playing style of Marseille last season, it was an absolute joy to be playing in this system and to play all the games to win them.”

If this wage issue is not resolved, Payet will have no choice but to look at the offers coming to him from the Premier League. In this regard, West Ham are in the driving seat, ready to offer the player €400k gross a month on a four year deal. More undoubtedly to follow.

item.title: Aston Villa have made an offer for Jordan Amavi
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to our colleagues at France Football, Aston Villa have made a formal offer for OGC Nice left back Jordan Amavi. Nice accepted the offer, according to the report, because of how financially good it was, but the player himself is … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to our colleagues at France Football, Aston Villa have made a formal offer for OGC Nice left back Jordan Amavi.

Nice accepted the offer, according to the report, because of how financially good it was, but the player himself is not particularly enthused by a move to the Birmingham outfit. More undoubtedly to follow.

item.title: Chelsea reach deal for Falcao, according to L’Équipe
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to our colleagues at L’Équipe, Chelsea have now reached a deal with AS Monaco for the loan signing of Radamel Falcao. The deal includes a one year loan worth €10m with a buy-out clause of €50m, according to the report. … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to our colleagues at L’Équipe, Chelsea have now reached a deal with AS Monaco for the loan signing of Radamel Falcao.

The deal includes a one year loan worth €10m with a buy-out cl ause of €50m, according to the report. Indications at the end of last week suggested that there would be no buy-out clause in the deal, but Monaco Vice President Vadim Vasilyev was in London at the weekend to encourage Chelsea to accept a buy-out clause in the deal.

The deal should be wrapped up by Thursday, according to the French daily.

item.title: AC Milan enter the race for Giannelli Imbula
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: AC Milan sensationally entered the race for Marseille midfielder Giannelli Imbula after making a €28m offer for Imbula and left-back Benjamin Mendy, according to Sky Italia. AC Milan were quickly informed that Benjamin Mendy would absolutely be staying at Marseille, … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
AC Milan sensationally entered the race for Marseille midfielder Giannelli Imbula after making a €28m offer for Imbula and left-back Benjamin Mendy, according to Sky Italia.

AC Milan were quickly informed that Benjamin Mendy would absolutely be staying at Marseille, the player’s wish more than anything else.

As a result, Marseille will meet with AC Milan today for discussions concerning just Giannelli Imbula. Inter Milan still lead the race for the player, having already agreed provisional terms. Marseille want €25m.

item.title: Nicolas Benezet close to Guingamp?
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: According to Ouest France, Evian winger Nicolas Benezet is close to a move to Guingamp on a permanent basis after a successful loan spell with Caen since January. A deal for around €1.5m is being rumoured, but Caen have also tried … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
According to Ouest France, Evian winger Nicolas Benezet is close to a move to Guingamp on a permanent basis after a successful loan spell with Caen since January.

A deal for around €1.5m is being rumoured, but Caen have also tried to convince the player to join them permanently.

item.title: Giannelli Imbula: Inter Milan in the driving seat
item.dc:creator: Christian Nourry
item.description: Marseille at the moment are prioritising a sale of either Giannelli Imbula or Florian Thauvin. Marseille must sell a player in order to abide to the agreement they made with French football financial watchdog the DNCG, which is set to … Read more »
item.content:encoded:
Marseille at the moment are prioritising a sale of either Giannelli Imbula or Florian Thauvin. Marseille must sell a player in order to abide to the agreement they made with French football financial watchdog the DNCG, which is set to allow them to balance the boo ks.

Marseille President Vincent Labrune had been banking on the sale of Imbula, but Valencia are believed to have pulled out of a deal because of the signing of Rodrigo Caio, a move made by Jorge Mendes and Valencia owner Peter Lim which has infuriated the Valencia board, who wanted Imbula instead.

Inter Milan are however well positioned for the player and talks are ongoing, but it is believed that Marseille are asking for a little more than the €19m initially offered, wanting closer to €25m. Giannelli Imbula’s father told Téléfoot on Sunday that his son could accept a move to the Serie A side.

According to Sky Italia today, Manchester City and Tottenham Hotspur have entered into the race to sign the central midfielder. Giannelli Imbula’s father has announced on RMC that it is a three horse race for his son between Inter Milan, Valencia and an English side, although we believe that VCF have now pulled out. He also confirmed that there was a 90% chance that the player will leave Marseille this window. According to Gianluca di Marzio, Imbula has already agreed a provisional contract with Inter Milan.
